importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the indictment, indicating the official timeline of legal action against John Bolton, underscores the seriousness and timing of the federal investigation into national security disclosures.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current year of the indictment reflects a significant moment in U.S. political and legal discourse, especially concerning national security and post-presidential accountability.

keyTakeAways: John Bolton, a former national security adviser to President Donald Trump, has been indicted by a federal grand jury in Maryland.
The indictment includes 18 charges: eight counts of transmitting national defense information and 10 counts of retaining national defense information.
The charges relate to alleged violations of national security laws involving classified information.
The indictment marks a major legal development in the ongoing scrutiny of former national security officials following the end of the Trump administration.

namedEntities.name: John Bolton
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former U.S. National Security Adviser under President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: John Bolton is relevant to the world outside of the article because he is a prominent political figure whose actions and statements have influenced U.S. foreign policy and national security decisions during the Trump administration, shaping public discourse on geopolitics and leadership.

namedEntities.name: President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former President of the United States
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: President Donald Trump is relevant to the article because the indictment of John Bolton is tied to his administration, indicating that the legal case may stem from actions or relationships during the time Bolton served as national security adviser.

namedEntities.name: Maryland
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: U.S. State where the federal grand jury conducted the indictment
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Maryland is relevant because it is the jurisdiction where the federal grand jury issued the indictment, indicating the legal process and geographic scope of the investigation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: John Bolton, former national security adviser to President Donald Trump, has been indicted by a federal grand jury in Maryland on 18 counts, including eight for transmitting and 10 for retaining national defense information. The charges suggest potential breaches of national security laws related to classified information, placing Bolton at the center of a broader political and legal scrutiny following the end of the Trump administration.
title: Full indictment of John Bolton
